website_summaries.verdict: This road cycling shoe from Pearl Izumi is crafted to provide exceptional power transfer from the foot to the pedal. Its outsole is engineered to be stiff to make pedaling virtually effortless on flat roads. It also has rubber bumpers to make walking less awkward. Meanwhile, the top has ventilation features that keep the foot fresh during extended periods of rides. To top it all off, it is comfortable to use and quite stylish.
pros: The comfort delivered by the Pearl Izumi Race Road v5 impresses a ton of reviewers
Many users commend the sturdy build of this road cycling shoe
A lot of people appreciate the roomy forefoot yet snug heel fit of this model
According to more than a few consumers, this product is affordable
Plenty of owners rave about how quickly they got the footgear on and off because of the BOA dial
Multiple wearers say this footgear is breathable, which they like
The style of this athletic footwear pleases numerous buyers
cons: A few cyclists suggest that Pearl Izumi relocate the BOA dial in the next iteration to improve fit adjustment in the Race Road line
One person reports bending of the outsole when pedaling uphill

customer_reviews.title: BOA System needs refinement.
customer_reviews.text: The BOA system needs to be improved. The lockdown system doesn’t fully tighten the entire upper. It seems to pull only in one area causing discomfort and lack of fit. The lacing setup is a bit weird in how it feeds and the use of fabric lace loops doesn’t allow for ease of sliding for the laces. If the shoe used the BOA plastic lace guides and a better lace orientation these shoes would be great! For reference I wear a size men’s 7->8 shoe (dress->running shoe) and purchased a 40.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: not for sprints...
customer_reviews.text: comfortable, good fit cool. very well made. one concern. if your cleats are neer midfoot, shoe flexes during hard hills, or sprints. wish whole bottom was carbon...

customer_reviews.title: comfortable and functional
customer_reviews.text: my husband had cheaper cycling shoes that by mile 40 were hurting the outside of his feet, specifically the small toe side. the cheaper shoes were hard on top and had no give. these shoes have more flexibility and come in wide sizes. he has ridden over 40 miles with no pain. he also loves the convenience of the dial laces, so much easier when and if he needs to adjust while riding.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Great cycling shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I love these cycling shoes! I use them for indoor spinning. As a female with slightly wider feet, these have a roomier toebox and are very comfortable. The lacing system is great and works fast and easy. These feel more streamlined and less bulky than many other cycling shoes I tried on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fit is smaller than normal
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting the fit to be a little small, so I ordered a whole size up and I am very pleased with the fit. The shoes cinch well and the BOA system is really nice. they look awesome and are durable, I wish the entire bottom of he shoe was carbon, that would be a bit better, but the function and weight of the show is great. I am not disappointed.
